com.nutiteq.rasterlayers
Class RasterLayer

java.lang.Object
  com.nutiteq.layers.Layer
      com.nutiteq.rasterlayers.RasterLayer
Direct Known Subclasses:
PackagedMapLayer, StoredMapLayer, TMSMapLayer
public class RasterLayer
extends Layer

Raster layer base class. Should be used together with corresponding data source. Contains methods for controlling caching policy and some visual attributes.

Constructor Detail

RasterLayer

public RasterLayer(RasterDataSource dataSource,
                   int id)
Default constructor.

Parameters:
dataSource - tile data source for the layer.
id - unique layer id. Id for the layer must be depend ONLY on the layer source, otherwise tile caching will not work properly.

getTileColor

public Color getTileColor()
Get active tile color. Default is white.

Returns:
current tile color.

setTileColor

public void setTileColor(Color color)
Set tile color. Tile texture will be modulated by this color. This method allows making layer partially transparent, by setting alpha channel appropriately. In this is case it is strongly advisable to turn tile fading off, otherwise visible artifacts may occur.

Parameters:
color - the new tile color.

isTileFading

public boolean isTileFading()
Get tile fading state for this layer. By default fading is enabled for all layers.

Returns:
fading flag value

setTileFading

public void setTileFading(boolean tileFading)
Enable or disable tile fading for this layer. By default fading is enabled for all layers.

Parameters:
tileFading - fading flag value

getFetchPriority

public int getFetchPriority()
Get priority of data retrieval. Default is 0.

Returns:
relative priority value

setFetchPriority

public void setFetchPriority(int priority)
Set priority for data retrieval. If this layer downloads data from network, this method allows to prioritize base layer by giving higher priority value to base layer and lower priority values to other layers.

Parameters:
priority - relative priority. Default priority is 0.

isMemoryCaching

public boolean isMemoryCaching()
Check if in-memory caching is enabled for this layer.

Returns:
true if enabled, false if not.

setMemoryCaching

public void setMemoryCaching(boolean flag)
Enable/disable in-memory caching for this layer.

Parameters:
flag - if true, in-memory cache will be used. If false, not. By default in-memory caching is enabled.

isPersistentCaching

public boolean isPersistentCaching()
Check if persistent caching is enabled for this layer.

Returns:
true if enabled, false if not.

setPersistentCaching

public void setPersistentCaching(boolean flag)
Enable/disable persistent caching for this layer.

Parameters:
flag - if true, persistent cache will be used. If false, not. By default persistent caching is disabled.

getId

public int getId()
Return the layer id specified in the constructor.

Returns:
layer id.

getTileIdOffset

public long getTileIdOffset()
Get tile id offset for the layer. This id offset should be added to the tile id before inserting tiles to the cache.

Returns:
tile id offset for the layer.

updateVisibleTiles

public void updateVisibleTiles()
Not part of public API. Request the update of tiles.

fetchTile

public void fetchTile(MapTile tile)
Start appropriate task for fetching the requested tile. This gets called when a visible tile can't be found in any of the caches and thus must be reloaded from the source. Inheriting classes can either start a new task immediately or wait for the flush command to start all at once. NB! You need to start the task in your implementation, it is not done automatically. If you have online tiles then usually you calculate your URL (urlString) and the following line is the last one in your implementation: components.rasterTaskPool.execute(new NetFetchTileTask(tile, components, tileIdOffset, urlString));

Parameters:
tile - the requested tile

flush

@Deprecated
public void flush()
Deprecated. 

Flushes the currently pending tiles list. Gets called every time the screen changes and all the tiles that have to be fetched have been determined. Implementing this is not required, if the fetchTile method starts the appropriate tasks itself.
